title: Why are Kennen buffs on PBE?
body:
Kennen
Mark of the Storm (Passive) Stun duration increased to 1.25 seconds from 1

Kennen doesnt need a buff, there are champion who need buffs and Kennen is obviously not in this pool.

replies.body:
This is just a tooltip fix, turns out Mark of the Storm's duration was increased to 1.25s years ago but that wasn't documented (our bad).

We've also got a second bug fix for Kennen in the upcoming patch that fixes a case where his W occasionally doesn't target enemies recently affected by his ult.

Good to hear About the Bug Fix.

You know? This is indication of bad code.

The tooltip itself shouldn't ever have needed fixing, It should draw it's numbers from the same variable as the abbility..

Mistakes like this happen all the time and there probably are a couple hundred others like this if more of your code is that way.
Is there going to be a bugfix for Kennen W being activated and going on CD (while doing absolutely nothing) when he walks out of range during the cast time?

I imagine the thought is like so: Running into the evemy team, CCing them and doing aoe damage are all things that tanks already accomplish just fine right now with a righteous glory - basically leaving kennen as a squishier, easier-to-kill version.

I'm sure he's not weak, but when the meta basically makes him redundant by having plenty of tanks do his job without dying, then a slight buff could be justified.

Such as a fourth of a second longer on his stun.

I could be wrong, but these are my thoughts.

Given that Kennen has bar none THE most spammable hard CC in the game, giving him extra duration on it is just asking for problems.

And he seriously doesn't need buffs.

He gains a quarter-second on the first stun, and an eighth of a second on subsequent stuns. For that to even measure an extra half-second, he has to stun the same person 3 times in a fight. Never mind that **Tenacity still exists.**
Think less the duration of one fight, and more the duration of a game.
How is stun duration more important over the duration of a game instead of over the duration of a fight?
Because of all the trades it will win. All the time it will buy Kennens to just E away from ganks. All the time for junglers or other teammates to come in to grab kills.

That's still focusing on the fight. CC creates a pause in the fight that allows others to capitalize. Yes, it's a slightly larger window of opportunity for Kennen and his allies. Kinda how a CC duration buff works, it's obviously the point of the buff.

And while some people call it unnecessary, Kennen's been underwhelming for a long time. Sure, he has one of the most easily repeatable stuns in the game, but it also has one of the highest requirements to actually land the stun.
Take a look at his winrates. Kennen's perfectly fine.

Because win rate is a perfect measure of a champion's balance--OH WAIT, NOPE.

Win Rate is *one* indicator of a champion's current state of balance.
Riven has a knockup, which can't even be reduced by tenacity.
**Who the fuck was talking about Riven?** How is that relevant at all?!?
